It is understandable that you may be skeptical of polls and their results. However, it is important to recognize that accurate and unbiased polling can provide valuable information about public opinion and is used by policymakers, business leaders, and other decision-makers to make informed decisions.

While it is true that some politicians and interest groups may use polls selectively to promote their agendas, reputable polling organizations strive to be objective and independent, and use rigorous methods to reduce bias and obtain accurate data.

As a consumer of polling data, it is crucial to approach poll results with a critical eye, to evaluate the methodology used by the pollsters, and to consider any potential biases that may exist. However, dismissing all polls as unreliable or biased is not a constructive approach, as it can lead to a lack of trust in the democratic process and an inability to accurately gauge public opinion.
